Hi!
I've completed the writing out of a scenario in text form, so now one of the
conversions works, and it looks like it's working properly too!

For now the half functional program, along with a couple of screenshots I
took a few days ago, is up on my website at:
www.twarriors.com/deathifier/
That directory is my 'dumping-ground' with only a file listing, the file you
probably want is the exe - the two PNG files are the screenshots.

Just for information:
The file is ~200k, it's that large because it's a debug build, a retail
build is generally 50k :)
Put it wherever you want, I suggest you put it in its own little directory -
you can select files to convert from anywhere on your computer, your LAN and
probably a few other places, and it'll put the converted text file in the
same spot.
When you run it the program produces a programlog.txt file, and if it
crashes it'll produce a programerror.txt file.
The log usually contains status updates as to what it's doing, it doesn't
report much though, I can never seem to work out what should be reported and
what shouldn't (unless its an error or similar).
It's quite safe to remove both of the files too.

The interface should be pretty easy to use, unless you can't read english :)
The text -> scenario converter won't work, it shouldn't do anything if you
press the convert button.

That should be everything, it shouldn't go crashing on you, and it converted
some test files properly (DPH's torture scen 401 makes generates almost 1MB
of data).  It won't accept non-version 8 files, and non-scenario files
either, so don't try feeding it those :)

Anyway, have fun with it!

The last thing I've got a question (probably best if Tom could answer
this) - the information we were given has the Scenario Type as a character,
and George said it was either a 0 or 1 in the files he checked - but 0 and 1
don't actually represent characters, so shouldn't they be stored as bytes (I
know the difference isn't much).
For printing out I treat it as a short int (sprintf doesn't have a byte
format specifier...) rather than a character so you can actually see it,
otherwise it'd be blank.

Cya,
Deathifier
